description.narrative: The development objective of the project is (a) to improve the reliability of India's Northern Electricity Grid through the addition of renewable, low carbon energy from the Rampur hydropower project; and (b) to improve the effectiveness of Satluj Jal Vidyut Nigam Limited (SJVN) with respect to the preparation and safe implementation of economically, environmentally, and socially sustainable hydropower projects.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Loan Agreement, Schedule 2, Section I, 4 (b) | Description :RAP Studies - Borrower (SJVN) shall carry out 2 RAPstudies, to assess the impact of implementation of RAP on changes in living standard of project affected persons | Due Date:31-Dec-2009

Finance Agreement :Loan Agreement, Schedule 2, Section II, 5 | Description :Annual Accounts - Borrower shall furnish to the Bank,within 6 months of end of fiscal year, audited financial statements | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Loan Agreement, Schedule 2, Section II, 5 | Description :Internal Audit Report - Borrower shall furnish to theBank, within 3 months of end of fiscal year, internal audit report with details of actions taken to address identified issues |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Loan Agreement, Schedule 2, Section II, 6(a) | Description :Accounts Receivables - Borrower to maintain itsaccount receivables at a level not exceeding an amount equivalent to its billing for energy generation for the preceding 3 months |Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Loan Agreement, Schedule 2, Section II, 6(b) | Description :Financial Projections - Borrower shall furnish tothe Bank, by December 31 of each year, its ten-year financial projections, including its investment program and financing plan |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Loan Agreement, Schedule 2, Section II, 7(a) | Description :Debt to Equity ratio - Borrower shall not incur anydebt, if after the incurrence of such debt the ratio of debt to equity is greater than 4 to 1 | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Improved reliability of India's Northern Electricity Grid - % of time frequency in the Northern Electricity Grid is in the operating band of Indian Electricity Grid Code

comment.narrative: Figure for the period April 2006 to March 2007

Figures are for the period April 2013 to January 2014. Till April, 2010 the IEGC band was 49.2 to 50.3 Hz and subsequently it wasnarrowed to 49.5 to 50.2 Hz. From September 17, 2012, the IEGC band was further narrowed to 49.7 to 50.2 Hz. From February 1, 2014,the Northern, Western, Eastern, North-Eastern and Southern Region Grid have been interconnected and From February 17, 2014, theIEGC band has been further narrowed to 49.9 to 50.05 Hz.

title.narrative: Improved reliability of India's Northern Electricity Grid - Reduction in the number of days of outage of NJHP in wet season (based on 3 year rolling average)

comment.narrative: Figure indicates the 3 year rolling average of the number of days of outage of NJHP. Baseline figure is not a 3 year rollingaverage.
NJHP was shut down due to high silt content in river for 9.5 days in FY2014.

title.narrative: Resettlement and Rehabilitation - payment of compensation and construction grants

comment.narrative: 99.5% of families out of the 208 families have received full compensation and rehabilitation benefits

title.narrative: Construction of the 412 MW Rampur run-of-river hydroelectric scheme - % completion of Power House excavation works

comment.narrative: Overall quantity to be excavated has increased due to design changes

title.narrative: Construction of 412 MW Rampur run-of-river hydroelectric scheme - per cent completion of Head Race Tunnel excavation works
Generation Capacity of Hydropower constructed or rehabilitated under the project

comment.narrative: Generation capacity of Hydropower constructed under the project
Five units have been successfully synchronized with the Northern grid and are under commercial operation

title.narrative: Generation Capacity of Hydropower constructed under the project

comment.narrative: Five units have been successfully synchronized with the Northern grid and are under commercial operation

title.narrative: Improved reliability of India's Northern Electricity Grid - Increased power availability to Northern region off-takers (GWh equivalent per annum)

comment.narrative: Increased power availability to Northern region off-takers (GWh equivalent per annum)
